examples.name: Food Delivery App Redesign
examples.description: Complete Double Diamond for redesigning food delivery app experience
examples.useCase: Consumer mobile app with UX problems
highlights: Discovery revealed decision fatigue and unreliable ETAs as key problems
Problem definition focused on confidence and time management
Development generated 7 distinct solution concepts
Delivery combined best elements into unified 'Confident Ordering' solution

examples.name: Healthcare Patient Portal
examples.description: Double Diamond for improving patient portal usability
examples.useCase: Healthcare B2C portal for appointment management and records
highlights: Discovery with patients and healthcare providers
Problem definition around medical information comprehension
Design principles emphasizing clarity and empowerment
Solution focused on plain language and visual health timelines

examples.name: Enterprise Dashboard Discovery
examples.description: Discovery and definition phases for enterprise analytics dashboard
highlights: Discovery phase with data analysts and executives
Problem definition converged on 'insight discovery vs. report generation'
Design principles balancing depth and simplicity
Stopped at definition to validate problem with stakeholders

examples.name: Smart Home App Concept Development
examples.description: Development and delivery phases for smart home control app
examples.useCase: IoT consumer app for home automation
highlights: Started from existing problem definition
Development generated 8 concepts from manual to fully automated control
Delivery converged on 'Intelligent Suggestions' with manual override
Implementation plan with phased rollout of automation features

examples.name: Educational Platform for Teachers
examples.description: Complete Double Diamond for teacher classroom management tool
examples.useCase: EdTech B2B platform for K-12 teachers
highlights: Discovery revealed teacher time management crisis
Multiple iterations: first diamond too broad, second zoomed into grading workflow
Development concepts ranged from AI auto-grading to better manual workflows
Final solution balanced automation with teacher judgment and control

examples.name: Retail Store Checkout Redesign
examples.description: Discovery phase only for retail checkout experience
examples.useCase: Physical retail store checkout process improvement
highlights: User research through observation and interviews
Discovered tension between speed (customers) and thoroughness (staff)
Problem areas: payment friction, loyalty program confusion, bag packing delays
Discovery complete, ready for definition workshop with store managers

fullWorkflow.description: Complete Double Diamond from discovery through delivery

problemExploration.description: Discovery and definition only to validate problem before solution work

solutionDevelopment.description: Development and delivery with pre-existing problem definition

beginner.reason: Simple discovery phase showing divergent thinking in familiar context
keyLearnings: Identifying problem areas without jumping to solutions

intermediate.reason: Complete diamond showing all four phases clearly
keyLearnings: Convergent problem definition from broad insights
Converging to final solution with implementation plan

advanced.reason: Shows iteration - running multiple diamonds to refine scope
keyLearnings: Zooming in from broad to specific
Balancing stakeholder constraints with user needs

consumer.notes: Consumer apps emphasize ease of use, delight, and emotional connection. Discovery often reveals unstated desires and frustrations.

healthcare.notes: Healthcare requires special attention to comprehension, trust, and accessibility. Design principles must address health literacy and patient empowerment.

enterprise.notes: Enterprise tools balance power-user needs with simplicity. Multiple stakeholder perspectives must be reconciled in problem definition.

education.notes: EdTech must respect teacher expertise while addressing time constraints. Solutions should enhance, not replace, teacher judgment.

retail.notes: Retail involves physical and digital touchpoints. Must balance customer experience with operational efficiency and staff needs.

discoveryInsights: Gap between what users say and what they do
Unstated emotional needs alongside functional ones
problemStatementFormats: [User group] struggle to [goal] because [root cause], resulting in [impact]
[User group] need a way to [job to be done] but [current solution] doesn't [capability gap]
When [situation], [user group] can't [desired action] which leads to [consequence]
ideationTechniques: SCAMPER (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to other use, Eliminate, Reverse)
Worst possible idea (then flip to best)
